snippet: Europe offered Turkey $3.2 billion dollars to cope with two million Syrian refugees there so they stay out and invited Turkey to discussions that could aid its efforts to join the European Union.
abstract: European Union closes in on deal which would pay Turkey around $3.2 billion over next two years to help handle over two million Syrian refugees there; Turkey expected to push for EU inclusion in return for its crucial assistance with migrant crisis, while Western nations remain concerned by Turkish regime's repressive political actions.
lead_paragraph: Europe offered Turkey $3.2 billion dollars to cope with two million Syrian refugees there so they stay out and invited Turkey to discussions that could aid its efforts to join the European Union.

headline.main: Europe Nears Accord With Turkey to Stem Tide of Refugees
headline.print_headline: Europe Nears Deal With Turkey on Regulating Refugee Flow

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
